question_text: Which of the following statements is true in evaluation of upper airway obstruction?

options.A: Additional inspiratory lateral view of the neck is needed for assessment of subglottic stenosis.
options.B: In most conditions, soft tissue neck study is usually sufficient to make the diagnosis.
options.C: Pediatric patients with respiratory distress should be immobilized.
options.D: Supine position is the preferred position in the setting of acute epiglottitis.

question_text: What is the gold standard for cardiac function assessment for pediatric patients?
What is the contrast of choice in pediatric patients with intussusception during fluoroscopic reduction?
In intravenous urography for pediatric patients, a poorly visible nephrogram likely indicates which of the following conditions?

options.D: Obstruction of the renal collecting system

question_text: The following are indications for voiding cystourethrogram EXCEPT:

options.A: Detailed anatomic evaluation of the bladder
options.B: Detailed anatomic evaluation of the renal parenchyma and collecting system
options.D: Study of the anatomy of the male urethra

question_text: Which of the following statements comprise proper technique for mediolateral oblique (MLO) view of mammography?

options.B: Pectoralis muscle shadow is perpendicular to the posterior nipple line
options.C: Presence of inframammary fold which ensures adequate compression of the retromammary region
options.D: Visualization of the pectoralis minor muscle

question_text: What is the diagnostic mammographic view that will verify skin lesions and show palpable lesion obscured by dense tissue?
The following statements are true about patient positioning for breast MRI, EXCEPT:

options.A: Arms are up by the patient's head
options.C: Axillary tail not included in the field of vision
options.D: Prone position to minimize respiratory motion

question_text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication in performing hysterosalphingogram?
What Biophysical parameter evaluates for chronic fetal hypoxia?
Which of the following statements is TRUE about the gestational age?

options.A: Accurate prediction is made by a composite of biparietal diameter, fetal length and abdominal girth
options.B: Accurate to about 1.1 weeks at 12-18 weeks
options.C: Assigned during the first ultrasound and may be changed if the last menstrual period (LMP) varies on subsequent ultrasound
options.D: Most accurate as the pregnancy advances

question_text: What diagnostic imaging method will enable real time radiographic visualization of moving anatomic structures (e.g. peristalsis)?
Which of the following structures will attenuate x-ray beam the least?
What is the signal intensity of a lesion with restricted diffusion?

options.C: isointense to brain parenchyma on DWI

question_text: Which of the following brain metabolite changes is most likely associated with tumor?

options.C: Elevation of choline to creatine ratio
options.D: Elevation of N-acetyl aspartate to creatine ratio

question_text: What is the preferred initial imaging study for stroke?
Which of the following findings is compatible with CT and MRI appearance of subacute blood?

options.A: Isodense to gray matter (CT) and hyperintense (T1WMRI)
options.B: Isodense to gray matter (CT) and hypointense (T1WMRI)
options.C: Isodense to gray matter (CT) and isointense (T1WMRI)
options.D: Isodense to gray matter (CT) and mixed signal (T1WMRI)

question_text: What is the radiologic method of choice for investigating a patient suspected on clinical or radiologic grounds of having bronchiolitis or interstitial lung disease?
As a general rule, what imaging exam should constitute the first step in establishing the presence of a disease process in the lungs?
What physiologic compromise is often seen in chest images performed using portable radiography?
Why is it difficult to evaluate pulmonary hypertension in a radiograph taken in AP supine position?

options.A: Physiologically the supine position elevates the diaphragm compressing the lower lobes
options.B: Supine position increases systemic venous return to the heart
options.C: Supine position magnifies the cardiac silhouette
options.D: The normal gravitational effect evens out the blood flow between the upper and lower zones

question_text: What special radiologic technique is used to detect small pneumothorax and air trapping?
What imaging examination is used mainly to assess chest dynamics such as in suspected diaphragmatic paralysis or in the evaluation of apparent pseudotumor images?
On coronary CTA, optimal timing is achieved when which of the following heart chamber is most opacified?
ECG gating is employed during coronary CT angiography to acquire the most optimal images at which phase of the cardiac cycle?
On coronary artery calcium screening, a patient is classified as high risk for underlying stenosis and future cardiac events when he obtains an Agatston score of 4 which corresponds to what value?
Coronary artery bypass graft patency is best assessed with which of the following procedures?
Which cardiac MRI sequence imparts bright signal to coherently flowing blood creating a "white blood" appearance similar to contrast studies?
The 17-segment standardized myocardial segmentation for regional analysis of left ventricular function and myocardial perfusion employed on cardiac MR and cardiac CT is derived from which plane?

options.D: Vertical long axis (left ventricular long axis, apical two chamber)

question_text: What is the imaging method of choice in the evaluation of hematuria and examination of the collecting system?
Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding imaging methods of the urinary tract?

options.A: CT urogram has improved contrast resolution than the traditional intravenous pyelography.
options.B: The arterial phase scan in CT urogram results in the characteristic cortico-medullary phase.
options.C: The renal parenchyma is normally uniformly enhanced in the pyelogram phase in CT urogram.
options.D: Ultrasound is used to characterize lesions, detect hydronephrosis and assess kidney size.

question_text: What is the imaging procedure which is independent of renal function performed by cystoscopic catheterization of the ureteral orifice followed by contrast injection?
What is the imaging method of choice for locating undescended testes and staging of testicular neoplasms?

Which of the following examinations is usually performed to diagnose congenital anomalies of the female genital tract and mechanical causes of infertility with demonstration of the uterine cavity and tubal patency?
What remains as the imaging modality of choice for the adrenal glands?
Which of the following statements is INCORRECT about prostate sonography?

options.A: It is most frequently used as a biopsy guide for patients in whom digital rectal exam or prostate-specific antigen suggests prostate cancer.
options.B: It is sufficiently sensitive and specific to screen prostate cancer.
options.C: It is useful to detect seminal vesicle masses and cysts.
options.D: Prostate ultrasound is performed with high frequency (often 7 MHz) intrarectal probe.

question_text: Doppler ultrasound is useful in differentiating the hepatic artery from the bile duct. Which of the following findings is indicative of the hepatic artery on Doppler study?

options.B: Continuous flow pattern modulated by respiration.
options.D: Triphasic wave pattern undulating with cardiac and respiratory motions.

question_text: Which of the following is a hepatobiliary-specific paramagnetic contrast agent?
Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to antegrade barium study?
With multidetector computed tomography (MDCT) multiphasic scan of the liver, at what time is the portal venous phase acquired after contrast IV injection?
What phase in the CT pancreatic protocol acquired nearly 35 to 40 seconds after administration of the contrast medium during which there is peak enhancement of the pancreas?
What MRI sequence exploits fat-water cancellation artifact and is best used in the demonstration of focal or diffuse hepatic steatosis?

options.B: T1-weighted in-phase and opposed-phase gradient echo

question_text: Which of the organs is examined with a prone spot view on routine barium enema?
What is the specialized fat-saturation imaging sequence used to reduce the signal intensity of fat and enhance the visibility of edema and other pathologic processes within bone marrow?
The following are advantages of MRI from CT scan, EXCEPT?

options.C: Produces outstanding soft tissue contrast resolution
options.D: Provides images in any anatomic plane.

question_text: Which of the following multiple spin echo sequences DOES NOT significantly reduce image acquisition time in MRI?
Which of these pelvic radiographic views is used to assess femoral capital epiphyses and Perthes in children?
Which of these imaging modalities is particularly useful in evaluation of complex bony injuries of the pelvis, sacro-iliac joints and for identifying bony fragments in the acetabulum?
Which of the imaging modalities will best provide better assessment of the muscles, joints and ligaments?
Which of the following is the most effective way to evaluate the ovaries?
